question:
Trojan Horse is a form of:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 23/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Trojan Horse is a type of malicious software that pretends to be a legitimate program but performs harmful actions when executed.
  • It is classified under virus attacks because it can infect the system by disguising itself and causing damage or stealing data.
  • Unlike worms, Trojan Horse does not self-replicate but relies on user interaction to spread.

Additional Information:

  • Trojan Horse attacks are deceptive, often tricking users into executing them by masquerading as useful software.
  • Service attacks generally refer to denial-of-service (DoS) attacks, which aim to disrupt services rather than infect systems.
  • Slammer and Melissa are specific types of worms, which are self-replicating malware distinct from Trojan Horses.

question:
________ refers to unsolicited commercial emails that flood the Internet.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 22/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Spam refers to unsolicited commercial emails that flood the Internet, often sent in bulk without the recipient's consent.
  • It is a form of unwanted email used mainly for advertising, phishing, or spreading malware.
  • Spyware is software that secretly collects information about a user without their knowledge, but it is not related to bulk unsolicited emails.

Additional Information:

  • Trojan Horse and Malware are types of harmful software but do not specifically refer to unwanted bulk emails.
  • Spam emails cause network congestion and annoy users but are usually harmless unless they contain malicious links.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a micro blogging site?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 22/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Microblogging sites allow users to share short updates, posts, or multimedia with others quickly and easily.
  • Twitter, Tumblr, and Pinterest are popular microblogging or content-sharing platforms.
  • Mouse is a hardware device, not a website or social media platform, so it is not a microblogging site.

Additional Information:

  • Twitter is primarily a microblogging platform with short posts called tweets.
  • Tumblr combines blogging with social networking and supports short posts.
  • Pinterest is a visual discovery and bookmarking platform often considered part of social media, allowing sharing of images and ideas.
  • Mouse is a computer peripheral used to control the cursor on a screen.

question:
In which year was the World Wide Web invented?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 14/03/2021 (Shift-II)

RRB NTPC Stage-I 08/01/2021 (Shift-I)

RRB NTPC Stage-I 11/04/2016 (Shift-III)

RRB NTPC Stage-I 03/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• The World Wide Web (WWW) was invented in the year 1989.
  • It was developed by Tim Berners-Lee, a British scientist working at CERN (European Organization for Nuclear Research).
  • The invention revolutionized how information is accessed and shared over the internet through websites and hyperlinks.

Additional Information:

  • The proposal for the World Wide Web was submitted in 1989 and implemented in the early 1990s.
  • Before the WWW, the internet existed but lacked a user-friendly way to navigate and access information.
  • The World Wide Web enabled the creation of web pages and browsers, making the internet widely accessible.

question:
What is the extension of www in relation to computers?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 18/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The extension "www" stands for World Wide Web.
  • It refers to the system of interlinked hypertext documents accessed via the Internet.
  • The World Wide Web allows users to browse websites using web browsers.

Additional Information:

  • World Wide Web was invented to organize and access information on the internet easily.
  • It is different from the internet itself, which is the underlying network infrastructure.
  • Web pages use URLs that often begin with "www" indicating they are part of the World Wide Web.

question:
Internet uses:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 14/03/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The Internet primarily uses packet switching technology.
  • In packet switching, data is broken into small packets that travel independently over the network and are reassembled at the destination.
  • This method is efficient and allows multiple communications to share the same network paths simultaneously.

Additional Information:

  • Circuit switching is used in traditional telephone networks where a dedicated path is established for the entire communication.
  • Telephone switching and telex switching are older switching technologies mainly used for voice and text communication respectively.
  • Packet switching enables better use of network resources and supports the bursty nature of internet traffic.

question:
________ is a mechanism used by the Government of India to contact citizens across India electronically via emails, outbound dialing and SMS messages.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 02/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• E-Sampark is a mechanism used by the Government of India to contact citizens electronically.
  • It uses emails, outbound dialing, and SMS messages to communicate important information.
  • The system helps the government efficiently reach a large number of people for awareness, updates, and services.

Additional Information:

  • E-Office is an electronic file management system for government offices.
  • E-Greetings refers to sending digital greeting cards.
  • E-MSIPS relates to schemes for migrant workers and industrial projects.
  • E-Sampark focuses specifically on mass communication with citizens via electronic channels.

question:
Internet was started in India on:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 01/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The Internet was officially started in India on 15 August 1995.
  • This marked the beginning of public internet services in India.
  • The service was initially provided by the government-owned company VSNL (Videsh Sanchar Nigam Limited).

Additional Information:

  • Before 1995, the internet was limited to academic and research institutions in India.
  • The launch on 15 August 1995 coincided with India’s Independence Day, symbolizing a new era of digital connectivity.
  • Since then, internet usage in India has grown rapidly, transforming communication, business, and education.

question:
The server of the Internet is also known as-

RRB JE Stage-II 31/08/2019 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The server of the Internet is also known as a Host.
  • A Host is any computer or device connected to the Internet that provides services or resources to other computers.
  • Servers (hosts) store, process, and deliver web pages, files, emails, and other data over the Internet.

Additional Information:

  • A Gateway connects different networks and translates data between them.
  • A Repeater amplifies signals to extend the range of a network.
  • A Hub is a basic networking device that connects multiple computers in a network but does not manage data like a server.

question:
_________ is a generic term, which refers to all the legal and regulatory aspects of Internet and the World Wide Web.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 31/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Cyber law is the generic term that refers to all legal and regulatory aspects of the Internet and the World Wide Web.
  • It deals with laws related to online privacy, cybercrimes, intellectual property, and electronic transactions.
  • Cyber law helps regulate activities on the internet to ensure security, privacy, and legal compliance.

Additional Information:

  • Cookies are small data files stored on a user’s computer by websites for tracking and personalization.
  • Tools refer to software or applications used for various purposes, not legal frameworks.
  • Hackers are individuals who exploit vulnerabilities in computer systems, often illegally.

question:
Which of the following is an audio file extension?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 19/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• WMA stands for Windows Media Audio and is an audio file extension.
  • It is used for storing audio data such as music or sound recordings.
  • Other options like MOV and WMV are video file formats, and MP5 is not a standard media file extension.

Additional Information:

  • WMA files are commonly used for music and audio streaming.
  • MOV is a multimedia container file format developed by Apple, primarily for video.
  • WMV stands for Windows Media Video, used for video files.
  • MP5 is often mistakenly mentioned but does not represent a recognized audio or video file format.

question:
In the URL, https://www.d2h.com/login.php, which component identifies the path of a web page?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 18/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• In the URL https://www.d2h.com/login.php, the component that identifies the path of the web page is /login.php.
  • The path specifies the exact location or file on the web server to be accessed.
  • Other parts of the URL include the protocol (https:), domain name (www.d2h.com), and part of the URL structure.

Additional Information:

  • https: indicates the protocol used for secure communication.
  • www.d2h.com is the domain name identifying the website.
  • /login.php points to the specific web page or script on the server.
  • The double slashes // separate the protocol from the domain.

question:
What was the first domain name ever registered in the World Wide Web?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The first domain name ever registered on the World Wide Web was www.symbolics.com.
  • It was registered on 15 March 1985 by Symbolics, Inc., a computer manufacturer.
  • This marked the beginning of domain name registration, which is essential for identifying websites on the internet.

Additional Information:

  • www.linux.com and www.computer.com were registered later as the internet grew.
  • Domain names serve as human-readable addresses for IP addresses of websites.
  • The registration of www.symbolics.com is considered a historic milestone in internet history.

question:
Buying or selling goods electronically is known as:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 30/12/2020 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Buying or selling goods electronically is known as e-commerce.
  • It involves conducting commercial transactions over the Internet or other electronic networks.
  • E-commerce enables businesses and consumers to trade products and services without physical stores.

Additional Information:

  • Finance relates to management of money and investments, not specifically online buying or selling.
  • Multimedia refers to the use of different content forms like text, audio, images, and video.
  • Money control is about managing finances, budgets, or financial markets, not buying or selling online.

question:
Which of the following websites is NOT related to Education?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 04/03/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The website www.onlinesbi.com is NOT related to education.
  • It is the official online portal of the State Bank of India (SBI), used for banking services.
  • Other websites like www.ignou.ac.in, www.ncert.nic.in, and www.education.nic.in are related to education and learning in India.

Additional Information:

  • www.ignou.ac.in is the website for Indira Gandhi National Open University.
  • www.ncert.nic.in is the official site of the National Council of Educational Research and Training.
  • www.education.nic.in is the Ministry of Education’s official website.

question:
In a web address, the domain indicator (Suffix) ‘.com’ stands for:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• In a web address, the domain indicator (suffix) “.com” stands for Commercial.
  • It was originally intended for commercial organizations or businesses.
  • Today, .com is the most widely used generic top-level domain (gTLD) for websites globally.

Additional Information:

  • Other domain suffixes include .org (organization), .edu (education), and .gov (government).
  • The .com domain is popular because it is easy to remember and recognized worldwide.
  • Many types of websites use .com, not just commercial businesses.

question:
A small text file created by a website that is stored in the user’s computer temporarily for that session is called __________ .

RRB NTPC Stage-I 08/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A small text file created by a website and stored temporarily on the user’s computer for that session is called a cookie.
  • Cookies help websites remember user preferences, login status, and browsing activity.
  • They improve user experience by enabling personalized content and session management.

Additional Information:

  • Bug refers to an error or flaw in software.
  • Cache stores web data temporarily to speed up page loading but is different from cookies.
  • Malware is malicious software designed to harm or exploit systems.

question:
In the e-mail address (India@solu.edu), India is the-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 16/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• In the email address India@solu.edu, India is the user name.
  • The user name identifies the specific mailbox or account of the user on the mail server.
  • The part after @ (i.e., solu.edu) is the domain name of the mail server.

Additional Information:

  • Password is a secret key for accessing the email account but is not shown in the email address.
  • Domain name represents the organization or service provider hosting the email.
  • Server name is part of the domain that refers to the mail server handling the emails.

question: An email address consists of _________ parts.
solution:
• An email address consists of 3 parts.
  • These parts are:
    1. User name (before the '@' symbol)
    2. The @ symbol itself
    3. Domain name (after the '@' symbol)

Additional Information:

  • The user name identifies the email account owner.
  • The domain name specifies the mail server or organization.
  • Together, these parts form a complete and unique email address.

question:
What facilitates remote login on a computer?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 07/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• TELNET facilitates remote login on a computer.
  • It allows a user to access and control a remote computer over a network.
  • TELNET provides a command-line interface to communicate with the remote system.

Additional Information:

  • RTP (Real-time Transport Protocol) is used for delivering audio and video over IP networks.
  • HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol) is used for accessing web pages.
  • FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is used for transferring files between computers.

question:
The beginning of internet was introduced as-

RRB JE 14/12/2014
option_2: US security forces network
option_3: A team of research scientist from the Bell laboratory
option_4: Contribution of all the above
solution:
• The beginning of the Internet was introduced as a project by the US security forces network, specifically through ARPANET, funded by the U.S. Department of Defense.
  • ARPANET was the first operational packet-switching network and the precursor to the modern Internet.
  • It was initially developed to maintain secure communication between military and research institutions.

Additional Information:

  • TCP/IP protocols were developed later to standardize communication over the network.
  • Researchers from Bell Labs contributed significantly to networking technologies but were not solely responsible for the Internet’s beginning.
  • Therefore, the US security forces network (ARPANET) is credited with the origin of the Internet.

question:
Telephone calls between two peoples over the internet is-

RRB NTPC Stage-I 07/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Internet Telephony refers to making telephone calls between two people over the Internet.
  • It uses Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technology to transmit voice data.
  • This method reduces cost compared to traditional telephone calls by using internet networks.

Additional Information:

  • E-Telephony is a less commonly used term and not standard.
  • Chatting refers to text-based communication over the internet.
  • E-Calling is not a standard or widely accepted term for internet-based calls.

question:
Which internet giant company has launched training program to promote its products online to empower rural self help group (SHG) in Telangana?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 09/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• The internet giant company that launched a training program to promote its products online and empower rural Self Help Groups (SHGs) in Telangana is Facebook.
  • Facebook partnered with the Telangana government to train SHG members, mostly women, in using Facebook Pages to market their products online.
  • This initiative aimed to enhance digital literacy and economic opportunities for rural communities by expanding their reach to a wider audience.

Additional Information:

  • The program started with pilot training sessions in Hyderabad, involving SHG representatives.
  • It is part of Facebook's broader efforts in India to support rural economic growth through digital platforms.
  • Empowering SHGs through online marketing helps improve their income and access to national and global markets.

question:
Which is the world’s oldest web browser?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The world’s oldest web browser is the World Wide Web browser, developed by Tim Berners-Lee in 1990.
  • It was the first browser to enable users to access and navigate websites using hyperlinks.
  • This browser laid the foundation for the modern web and introduced the concepts of URLs, HTTP, and HTML.

Additional Information:

  • The World Wide Web browser was a simple text-based browser initially called WorldWideWeb and later renamed to Nexus.
  • Mosaic, Opera, Netscape came later and were more advanced graphical browsers.
  • Tim Berners-Lee’s invention revolutionized how information is shared globally via the internet.

question:
Who was the founder of twitter?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 16/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• The founder of Twitter is Evan Williams.
  • Evan Williams co-founded Twitter in 2006 along with Jack Dorsey, Biz Stone, and Noah Glass.
  • He played a crucial role in developing Twitter into a major social media platform worldwide.

Additional Information:

  • Mark Zuckerberg is the founder of Facebook, not Twitter.
  • Tim Cook is the CEO of Apple, unrelated to Twitter’s founding.
  • Noah Ark is not associated with Twitter’s creation; Noah Glass was one of the early contributors but not the main founder.
  • Evan Williams also co-founded Blogger, a popular blogging platform.

question:
Who formed the e-mail?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 18/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• The person who formed the e-mail (invented electronic mail) is Ray Tomlinson.
  • In 1971, Ray Tomlinson developed the first networked email system and introduced the use of the @ symbol to separate the user name from the computer name.
  • His work laid the foundation for modern email communication used worldwide today.

Additional Information:

  • Mark Zuckerberg is the founder of Facebook, not related to email invention.
  • Bill Gates co-founded Microsoft, but did not invent email.
  • Steve Jobs co-founded Apple, also unrelated to the invention of email.
  • Ray Tomlinson’s email invention revolutionized communication in the digital age.

question:
Shiva Ayyadurai of Indian origin is associated with whose invention and image?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 02/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• Shiva Ayyadurai, of Indian origin, is associated with the invention of Email.
  • He claims to have developed the first electronic mail system in 1978 while working at the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey.
  • His system included many features of modern email like inbox, outbox, folders, and attachments.

Additional Information:

  • The invention of email has multiple contributors, but Shiva Ayyadurai is recognized for developing a full electronic mail system as a teenager.
  • The internet, keyboard, and mouse were invented by different individuals unrelated to Shiva Ayyadurai.
  • His claim has been debated, but he is still credited in popular media for pioneering email software.

question:
Facebook was started during which year?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 18/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Facebook was started in the year 2004.
  • It was founded by Mark Zuckerberg along with his college roommates at Harvard University.
  • Facebook quickly grew to become one of the largest social networking platforms worldwide.

Additional Information:

  • The platform was initially launched as TheFacebook in February 2004.
  • Facebook’s success transformed social media and online communication globally.
  • The company went public in 2012 and expanded its services rapidly after that.

question:
What does a hacker mean?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 28/03/2016 (Shift-I)
option_1: A person who sells goods on roadside pavement or streets
option_2: The person who has unauthorized access to data uses computer for
option_3: A person who sells only online computer
option_4: A person who records the telephonic conversation
solution:
• A hacker is a person who gains unauthorized access to data or computer systems.
  • Hackers use their computer skills to bypass security measures, often to steal, modify, or damage information.
  • They can be ethical (white-hat) or malicious (black-hat), depending on their intent.

Additional Information:

  • Option (a) describes a street vendor, which is unrelated to hacking.
  • Option (c) refers to someone selling computers online, not hacking.
  • Option (d) is about recording telephone conversations, which is not the definition of a hacker.
  • Hackers play a significant role in cybersecurity, both as threats and as security testers.

question:
A programme or piece of code that is loaded onto a person’s computer without his/her knowledge and runs against his/her wishes is a type of malware called:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 07/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• A programme or piece of code that is loaded onto a person’s computer without their knowledge and runs against their wishes is called a Virus.
  • A virus attaches itself to legitimate programs and spreads by replicating when the infected program runs.
  • It can damage files, slow down systems, or corrupt data.

Additional Information:

  • Spyware secretly gathers user information without consent.
  • Trojan Horse is malware disguised as legitimate software but harms the system once executed.
  • Zeus is a specific type of Trojan malware used mainly for stealing banking information.
  • Viruses require user action to spread, unlike worms that spread automatically.

question:
What is the correct full form of “VIRUS” in computer programming?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 22/02/2021 (Shift-II)
option_1: Vital Inter Change Result Until Source
option_2: Vital Information Resources Under Seize
option_3: Vital Information Recognize Search
option_4: Vital Information Record User Seize
solution:
• The correct full form of "VIRUS" in computer programming is "Vital Information Resources Under Seize".
  • This acronym describes how a virus targets and takes control of important information resources in a computer system.
  • Though not a technical term officially used in computer science, this full form is popularly used to explain the harmful nature of a virus.

Additional Information:

  • Viruses are malicious programs designed to damage, disrupt, or steal data from computers.
  • The term virus itself comes from biology, describing infectious agents, adapted metaphorically for harmful software.
  • Understanding this acronym helps in remembering the nature of viruses in cybersecurity contexts.

question:
In a web browser, which of the following is used to secure the website?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 02/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• To secure a website in a web browser context, typically technologies like HTTPS (SSL/TLS certificates) are used, but none of the given options (History, Task Manager, Favorite, Save as) directly relate to security.
  • Among the given options, (c) Favorite refers to bookmarking a website, which helps quick access but does not secure a website.
  • None of the listed options actually secure a website; this seems like a question error or misprint.

Additional Information:

  • History stores the list of visited websites, unrelated to security.
  • Task Manager manages browser or system tasks, not website security.
  • Favorite (bookmarks) saves website links for easy access, no security function.
  • Save as saves the current webpage locally, no security function.

question:
Project Loon………has a search engine project through which to provide access to the internet in rural and remote areas using high altitude helium filled balloons.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 05/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• Project Loon is a Google initiative that aims to provide internet access to rural and remote areas using high-altitude helium-filled balloons.
  • These balloons act as floating cell towers, enabling connectivity where traditional infrastructure is difficult to install.
  • The project is part of Google's effort to expand internet accessibility worldwide.

Additional Information:

  • Microsoft, Apple, and Yahoo do not have projects similar to Project Loon.
  • Project Loon was launched by Google’s parent company Alphabet under its innovation lab, X.
  • The technology helps bridge the digital divide in underserved areas by providing internet coverage from the stratosphere.

question:
A Trojans are type of ________.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 04/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Trojans are a type of malware.
  • They disguise themselves as legitimate software but perform malicious actions once executed.
  • Trojans can steal data, damage systems, or create backdoors for unauthorized access.

Additional Information:

  • Trojans differ from viruses because they do not replicate themselves.
  • They often rely on users to download and run them unknowingly.
  • Protecting computers from Trojans requires updated antivirus and cautious downloading.

question:
What is the login name and password verified for?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 05/04/2016 (Shift-III)
option_2: To re-authenticate the user
option_3: To provide formal access to the user
option_4: To complete the login formalities
solution:
• The login name and password are verified primarily for user’s proof — to confirm the identity of the person trying to access the system.
  • This verification ensures that only authorized users can access their accounts or resources.
  • It acts as a security measure to protect sensitive data and maintain privacy.

Additional Information:

  • While options (b), (c), and (d) sound related, the fundamental purpose is to authenticate the user's identity.
  • Authentication is the first step before granting any kind of access or completing login formalities.
  • Strong passwords and login credentials are essential for system security.

question:
What is the meaning of Net neutrality?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 05/04/2016 (Shift-I)
option_1: Preventing people from using the internet
option_2: Subsidy pricing of internet services
option_3: Free services provided by internet companies
option_4: Differential pricing of internet services
solution:
• Net neutrality means that internet service providers (ISPs) must treat all internet traffic equally, without any discrimination.
  • It means they should not slow down or block any website, content, or platform, nor charge different prices for different services.
  • Differential pricing, i.e., charging different rates for different services, is against net neutrality.

Additional Information:

  • Net neutrality keeps the internet open and equal for everyone.
  • Without it, big companies may get an advantage and small websites may suffer.
  • Many countries legally protect net neutrality.

question:
Who is Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger related to?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/03/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Jimmy Wales and Larry Sanger are the co-founders of Wikipedia, the free online encyclopedia.
  • They launched Wikipedia in 2001 as a platform for collaborative knowledge sharing.
  • Wikipedia is known for its open-editing model, allowing users worldwide to contribute and edit articles.

Additional Information:

  • Wikipedia is one of the largest and most popular reference websites globally.
  • It operates under the non-profit Wikimedia Foundation.
  • Unlike companies like Google or Facebook, Wikipedia focuses on free and accessible knowledge for everyone.

question:
CAPTCHA ……… is a computer program.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 31/03/2016 (Shift-I)
option_1: To separate the human input from machine input
option_2: To verify the user’s identification
option_3: To remove the virus
option_4: To be tested by the user
solution:
• CAPTCHA (Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart) is a computer program designed to distinguish human users from machines.
  • Its main purpose is to separate human input from automated machine input, preventing bots from abusing online services.
  • CAPTCHA typically presents challenges like distorted text or images that humans can solve but machines find difficult.

Additional Information:

  • CAPTCHA is widely used in online forms, registrations, and login pages to enhance security.
  • It helps in preventing spam, automated data scraping, and unauthorized access.
  • Various types of CAPTCHA include text-based, image-based, and audio-based tests.

question:
What is e-governance?

RRB Group-D 04/10/2018 (Shift-II)
solution:
• E-governance means the use of technology, especially the internet and digital tools, to deliver government services and improve governance.
  • It focuses on making government processes more efficient, transparent, and accessible to citizens through electronic means.
  • E-governance helps in streamlining administrative functions and enabling better communication between government and people.

Additional Information:

  • It includes services like online tax filing, digital certificates, public grievance redressal, and information dissemination.
  • E-governance reduces paperwork and corruption by automating tasks.
  • Many countries are adopting e-governance to make administration more citizen-friendly.

question:
Which of the following network protocol is used to send an e-mail over the internet?

RRB SSE 21/12/2014
solution:
• SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is the network protocol used to send emails over the internet.
  • It is responsible for sending, relaying, and forwarding outgoing emails from the sender’s email client to the recipient’s email server.
  • SMTP works alongside other protocols like POP3 or IMAP, which are used to receive emails.

Additional Information:

  • FTP is used for file transfers, not email sending.
  • SSH is used for secure remote login and commands.
  • POP3 is used to receive and download emails from the server to the client, not to send emails.
